get.description: This API returns a list of all rule groups configured for a specific engine.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: The index number from which the rule groups should be listed. This is used for pagination. For example, if you want to skip the first 10 rule groups, set the from parameter to 11.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Specifies the maximum number of rule groups to return in the response. The value must be between 1 and 50.

parameters.name: departmentId
parameters.description: Specifies the ID to filter rule groups by department. Only rule groups belonging to this department will be listed.

parameters.name: module
parameters.description: Represents the API name of the module for which you want to filter rule groups.

parameters.name: engineSysName
parameters.description: The system name of the engine (e.g., AUTOMATION_STUDIO, MACRO) to filter rule groups associated with a particular automation engine.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Specifies the status to filter rule groups. Only rule groups with the specified status ("ACTIVE" or "INACTIVE" or "SYSTEM_DEACTIVATED") will be returned.

parameters.name: rulegroupIds
parameters.description: The IDs of the rulegroups to list separated by commas. You can pass up to 50 IDs.

post.description: This API creates a new RuleGroup.
This API updates the status of a rule group to either active or inactive for the specified department.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the rule group whose status needs to be updated

parameters.name: departmentId
parameters.description: Department ID for which the rule group should be activated or deactivated.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Sets the status of the rule group. The allowed values are ACTIVE or INACTIVE.

get.description: This API is used to get a specific RuleGroup

delete.description: This API is used to delete a RuleGroup
